717541f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, from 49th to 50th Streets, showing in the foreground the new ten-story Lefcourt Building for executive offices
exclusively.
September 10, 1930.
Edwin Levick.
Neg ~ 1185

717542f-a.text:
Broadway, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of 49th Street, with the Rivoli Theatre in the centre. Also shown is the north side of
49th Street from Broadway to Seventh Avenue.
May 3, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

713413f-b.text:
West 49th Street, west from Broadway and showing prominently the Ambassador Theatre (No. 215). adjoining the new structure at the N.W. corner of Broadway that houses amongst others, the Paradise Restaurant. Faintly outlined and west of same is the spire of St. Malachy's R.C. Church. Appearing on the south side of the street, near Broadway is the Hotel Markwell (No. 220-222). This set consists of a negative and a
positive view.
1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

713413f-a.text:
West 49th Street, west from Broadway and showing prominently the Ambassador Theatre (No. 215). adjoining the new structure at the N.W. corner of Broadway that houses amongst others, the Paradise Restaurant. Faintly outlined and west of same is the spire of St. Malachy's R.C. Church. Appearing on the south side of the street, near Broadway is the Hotel Markwell (No. 220-222). This set consists of a negative and a
positive view.
1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

717545f-b.text:
Broadway, west side, north from West 49th Street, showing the Paradise Restaurant and the Translux News Theatre (Motion Picture) in the new structure at the N.W. corner of Wiest 49th Street. This corner was formerly the site of a 2-story structure that housed Brill Brothers, Clothiers and DalyeBilliard Hall, bearing Nos. 1615-1623 Broadway. This
is a set of two, consisting of a negative and a positive.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

717545f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from West 49th Street, showing the Paradise Restaurant and the Translux News Theatre (Motion Picture) in the new structure at the N.W. corner of Wiest 49th Street. September 1935.
